newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila bourse suspends trade after computer fault.
newsitem.headline: Manila bourse suspends trade after computer fault.

text.p: * Index falls 14.40 points before trading halt
The Philippine Stock Exchange suspended trading after about 20 minutes of moderate trade on Thursday due to a computer glitch, a bourse official said.
The official said the trading halt would be in effect until such time as the problem is resolved by the bourse's technicians who were still investigating the problem.
The composite index fell 14.40 points, or 0.43 percent, to 3,335.42 before the trading was suspended.
"Trading is a mess. We're trying to put in our orders but nothing is coming out on the screen," Lito Vicencio, a trader at Peregrine Securities, said.
Punters still ruled the market as thirdliners continued to attract heavy two-way trading. Blue chips were holding steady.

"There was no aggressive selling nor buying on the blue chips," Vicencio said, when asked how was the market reacting to the latest remarks of U.S. Fed chairman Alan Greenspan hinting at a possible increase in U.S. interest rates.
Debuting Reynolds regained its footing after an early weakness which saw its price fall to a low fo 4.05 pesos. It was at its offer price of 4.55 pesos before trading was suspended.
